intro: Atractylis ovata f. pinnatifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved marsh centaury, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It features a rosette of narrow, pinnatifid leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and marshy areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
